channel.title: Zero Hour | A Hyperion Development | Last updated 11-17-12
channel.description:
[center][IMG]http://i1109.photobucket.com/albums/h430/tyb97/Zero%20Hour/ZeroHourLogo.png[/img][/center] [b]Overview:[/b] Zero Hour is something I've been working on for probably almost a month now, I've progressed this a lot, but still have a while to go. The Zero Hour program idea was something I started a while back, I think in June, using some wL garbage, that eventually aggravated me, and I trashed. One day I just decided to switch it over to this base, with which I've been using for a while, and have gotten use to. [b]Goal:[/b] My goal for this server is to create a fun, well-rounded, unique server for my future players. I'm not going to focus on one section of the map, or one main purpose of the server, I want to create an environment for a good economy to develop, (if someone no-lifes for a week, is really lucky, and makes a ton of money, then quits and drops everything, well that's just too bad.), I also want to create a nice combat environment, where it's harder to have unfair people who enjoy making other people miserable to succeed in what they do. Lastly I want to create a good environment for skillers to prosper, where you won't get the short end of the stick if you don't player kill often. I would also like advantage of as much of the map as possible, so that it's not all cramped in one spot, and I could hide little surprises in the map for players to find, and other random events of the sort. [b]Final Plan:[/b] My plan is that once I have finished developing what I want to get done, I will release this into the BETA stages, in this stage the server will be ran either on my computer, or a friends computer. During this, we will see how many people really are for the server, donators and non-donators, if receive enough however, we can leave BETA, and go to 100% uptime, and really start rolling. In the end of it all, I'm going to go back, document everything, remove old, unused code, and release this to the public. [hr] I'll be posting media of what I've finished so far [center][IMG]http://i1109.photobucket.com/albums/h430/tyb97/Zero%20Hour/Welcome.png[/img] [IMG]http://i1109.photobucket.com/albums/h430/tyb97/Zero%20Hour/Prayer.png[/img] [IMG]http://i1109.photobucket.com/albums/h430/tyb97/Zero%20Hour/Potions.png[/img] [IMG]http://i1109.photobucket.com/albums/h430/tyb97/Zero%20Hour/Potions2.png[/img] [IMG]http://i1109.photobucket.com/albums/h430/tyb97/Zero%20Hour/NPCSpawning.png[/img] [IMG]http://i1109.photobucket.com/albums/h430/tyb97/Zero%20Hour/EquipmentBonuses.png[/img] [IMG]http://i1109.photobucket.com/albums/h430/tyb97/Zero%20Hour/Eating.png[/img] [IMG]http://i1109.photobucket.com/albums/h430/tyb97/Zero%20Hour/BoneBurying.png[/img] [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mX9xdVazSEI[/youtube] [/center] The following box will contain what I am working on at the moment, and I'll update every day, if there are updates to give.
[b]Combat[/b] [ul][li]Formula for accuracy created.[/li] [li]Formula for hit strength created[/li] [li]Combat design decided on[/li] [li]Player versus player weaponless combat base finished, ready for situation testing[/li][/ul]
[hr]
[center][b]Date:[/b] 11/8/12 [b]Entry #[/b]1[/center] [center]Finished a completely live door system, so it that everything won't appear different to all other players, if you open a door, log off, and nobody closes it, as long as the server doesn't undergo an update, the next time you log on it will still be open. Pretty cool if you ask me.[/center] [center][b]Date:[/b]11/9/12 [b]Entry #[/b]2[/center] [center]Finished the XML parsing for shops, and got that most of the way taken care of, next just need to add support for the shop container, and we are good to go on that part :)[/center] [center][b]Date:[/b]11/9/12 [b]Entry #[/b]3[/center] [center]Added 100% herb cleaning, so Herblore will be done quite soon, thanks to all of you that are following this.[/center] [center][b]Date:[/b]11/10/12 [b]Entry #[/b]4[/center] [center]A few things I'll put in this entry. First off, I started a ground item system, so that's underway. Wrote a class for Firemaking, really buggy and I need to work on a couple of clipping things before I get it working really well. That's on its way though. Also looked at starting systems for trading and dueling, so expect to see those features in the near future. I'm pretty much done for tonight though. Might start Smithing tomorrow.. Don't know.[/center] [center][b]Date:[/b]11/17/12 [b]Entry #[/b]5[/center] [center]Sorry haven't updated in a while, been busy with school. I'll go ahead and write an entry for today since I don't know how much more work I'll get done tonight. Some things I've done are started teleports, they will be like RS's for now, until I get my ideas straightened out. I wrote some classes for simple things like flax spinning, small, but features that most people don't even have. A pretty large move today was the introduction of constant NPC combat values. This marks the beginning for NPC vs. Player combat, which will be advanced at the same rate as PvP once I get going on it. I stopped item definitions from parsing 317+ items, those were only in the file. I'm not loading anything higher than the current revision (317). I also added parsing for item prices, so those are taken care of. I'm sure there was some other things I added, just can't think of them right now.. Thanks to all of those who support, expect another entry either tonight or tomorrow..[/center]
[hr]
I'll be posting ideas I have for the server here, please give me your thoughts. [b]Idea #1 - Learned Spells[/b]: Basically all learned spells are is instead of already having every teleport and spell already available as soon as you get the magic level and runes, you will have to complete various tasks to learn the spells, and such. Maybe I'll even change a few spells, to do things that aren't already defined.. Who knows :P [b]Idea #2 - Guilds and Clubs[/b]: To being, guilds and clubs are both different. Guilds are server-hosted, official places that will have their own headquarters, and such. Clubs are nonofficial, and are created by players. Both of them can have their own events, just guild events will be official, and club events won't, unless they get approved. I'll type more about this later, had a lot more info about this typed but my computer messed up...
[hr] Well I'm done typing. Love/Hate/Suggest/Flame, I don't care. Ask questions before you criticize though. Oh, and one last thing. Let me just acknowledge one particular person, AtomicInt_ (and everyone that has taught him), as he has always been free to help, and knows what he's talking about.
